intro: [WRONG START] Obernba behen subsp. glareosa, commonly known as the glabrous borage, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
